thread.title: 4-year-old gets her big birthday wish â€“ a CVS-themed party
thread.title_full: 4-year-old gets her big birthday wish â€“ a CVS-themed party | www.ajc.com

author: Christine Slusser
title: 4-year-old gets her big birthday wish â€“ a CVS-themed party
text:
This is Iris â€” a typical 4-year-old. She loves to dance, play and goof around.
"I'm ready to be a superstar!"
But something not so typical for her age: She also loves CVS.
Photo via @sarahfortune / Instagram >> Read more trending stories
So when Iris' mom, Sarah Fortune, asked her daughter what she wanted her birthday theme to be, it was no surprise she picked her favorite store.
"Why do you love CVS so much?" Fortune asked.
"Because of the snacks and chocolate milk," Iris said.
But having such a unique birthday theme wasn't a small task. And inspiration website Pinterest was no help.
So Fortune got to work. She had a CVS cake made , created a special name tag for Iris and had some party favors for the adults â€” prescription bottles filled with Tic Tacs .
Just posted the story behind Iris' love for CVS on the blog, along with lots of photos from her party! {link in profile}
A photo posted by Sarah Fortune (@sarahfortune) on Oct 16, 2015 at 4:34pm PDT
A four-year-old ready for her party!
A photo posted by Sarah Fortune (@sarahfortune) on Oct 15, 2015 at 2:15pm PDT
If you follow me on Snapchat, you've seen how the heck I'm pulling off a CVS themed birthday party tomorrow (or in this case, failing terribly). ðŸ‘» = sarah-fortune
A video posted by Sarah Fortune (@sarahfortune) on Oct 14, 2015 at 4:17pm PDT
Fortune blogged about her experience and said her daughter holds the drug store in such high regard, she wouldn't even pick it over Disney World.
"So when your kid puts CVS on the same level as Disney World, you embrace it," she said.
Fortune said it started when construction began on her city's first CVS in Fayetteville, Arkansas. Iris was only 3 when it opened, and she had watched it being built for half her life.
"So naturally, it was a big deal when the store finally opened," Fortune said.
CVS heard about the party and sent Iris a card and goodie bags.
As for the grown-ups, the party had a special adult beverage â€” cranberry vodka splash. CVS. Get it?
We're pretty sure CVS is loving the free publicity. Make a little girl happy, and get some free advertising. Win-win.
This video contains images and video from Sarah Fortune .
